abstracts.cdata!:
This amendment to the Credit Agreement
            of the Natural Disaster Mitigation Project in Honduras
            reflects significant factors that affected project
            implementation and will impact the overall outcome of the
            project. First, it is important that the Borrower's
            national capacity to prevent, mitigate, and respond to
            natural disasters, be institutionalized and strengthened, so
            that local (and national) programs be managed on a permanent
            basis; Second, at appraisal, the Project focused on
            technical assistance, but did not include financing for
            structural or non-structural aspects beyond the preparation
            of engineering designs, and feasibility studies for civil
            works needed for disaster mitigation. As a consequence of
            Hurricane Mitch, normal rains cause regular flooding, and
            landslides, therefore financing for construction, and basic
            infrastructure subprojects should be considered at this
            point of Project implementation. Third, it is necessary to
            improve Project management and coordination, and
            institutionalize project development objectives. The Project
            is seen as a means to promote cross-sectoral collaboration,
            to capitalize upon thematic synergies, and, above all, to
            sustain the development objectives of the Project. In
            particular, the new Office of Disaster Management, will
            develop and institutionalize a National System for
            Attention, Prevention and Mitigation of Natural Disasters
            which would be responsible for coordinating national, and
            local efforts in disaster response and risk management.
            Moreover, an extension of the closing date is required to
            ensure completion of Project implementation, and demonstrate
            continued support to its development objectives, given
            Project activities would not be finished by the current
            closing date, due to a slow implementation during the
            beginning of the project. The Credit Amendment include:
            modifications to required improvements of the national
            capacity of the Borrower, to reduce its vulnerability to
            natural disasters at the municipal level; modifications
            regarding drought management, instead of studies on fluvial
            geomorphology; capacity building for improved drought
            information management, required software, and design and
            implementation of a capacity building plan for drought
            responsiveness; and, support for the creation of a national
            system for disaster risk management, prevention, and
            responsiveness. Modifications to the Credit Agreement are in
            compliance with the Articles of Agreement, and, it is
            recommended to approve the Amendment in accordance with the
            terms set therein.
